label.description: Description narrative pour l'ensemble. Il s'agit du texte principal utilisé lors d'un affichage public de l'élément.

label.description: Berättande beskrivning, för gruppering. Detta är den primära texten som används när grupperingen visas offentligt.

label.name: Item description
label.description: Narrative description for item in this set. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the item in the context of this set.

label.description: Determines how set is rendered when displayed to the public in the Pawtucket/Pawtucket2 front-end.

label.name: Is primary item for set?
label.description: The item marked as primary will be used to represent the set as a whole when included in a list of sets.

label.name: Is primary item for set?
label.description: The item marked as primary will be used to represent the set as a whole when included in a list of sets.

label.name: Est l'item principal de l'ensemble ?
label.description: L'item marqué comme principal sera utilisé pour représenter l'ensemble comme un tout dans l'affichage d'une liste d'ensembles.

label.name: Är det primära objektet för gruppering?
label.description: Objekt markerad som primär kommer att användas för att representera grupperingen i sin helhet när det ingår i en lista över grupperingar.

label.description: Informations additionnelles à propos du mouvement de l'objet ou d'un groupe d'objets.

label.name: Förflyttning anteckning

label.name: Planerat borttagningsdatum
label.description: Datumet ett föremål faktiskt togs bort från dess nuvarande plats.

label.name: Reason for move
label.description: The purpose or reason for the movement of the object or group of objects.

label.name: Reason for move
label.description: The purpose or reason for the movement of the object or group of objects.

label.name: Raison du mouvement
label.description: Le motif ou la raison du mouvement de l'objet ou du groupe d'objets.

label.name: Orsak till flytt
label.description: Syftet eller skäl för förflyttning av objekt eller en grupp av objekt.

label.name: Inledning
label.description: Berättande beskrivning av turen. Detta är den primära texten som används när turen presenteras.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Location of this stop.

label.name: Georeference

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Location of this stop.

label.name: Georeferens
label.description: Plats för detta stopp.

label.name: Caption
label.description: Short descriptive caption for item.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Coordinates documenting the location of the item

label.name: GeoNames
label.description: A Geographic lookup that takes search text, passes it to the GeoNames search service and provides a dropdown with search results (ordered by score). Selected geoname is stored as both text (name, country, continent and ID) and the service URL identifier.

label.name: Library of Congress Subject Headings
label.description: Library of Congress Subject headings describing this object. To add a new heading simply type the first few letters of the heading and choose the desired one from the displayed list of possible matches.

label.name: Extent
label.description: The number of items or containers of material in an accession (lot) or collection, or the approximate length of the collection in feet.

label.name: href
label.description: refers to a hypertext reference that provides a link to another electronic resource.

label.name: pref
label.description: indicates that a particular data value is the preferred value when multiple data values for the same element or subelement exist.

label.name: refid
label.description: refers to id numbers or codes coming from the local institution or resource named in the source attribute.

label.name: rules
label.description: refers to any data content standards used to construct the value recorded in the element (e.g. AACR2, CCO).

label.name: source
label.description: refers to the local, print, or electronic source from which information is derived for a specific element (e.g. Grove Dictionary of Art).

label.name: vocab
label.description: refers to the controlled vocabulary source from which the term or phrase is recorded (e.g. AAT, LCSH)

label.name: Cultural context
label.description: The name of the culture, people (ethnonym), or adjectival form of a country name from which a Work, Collection, or Image originates, or the cultural context with which the Work, Collection, or Image has been associated.

label.name: Date
label.description: Date or range of dates associated with the creation, design, production, presentation, performance, construction, or alteration, etc. of the work or image. Dates may be expressed as free text or numerical. The circa attribute may be added to indicate an approximate date. For image records, the date element refers to the view date, if known.

label.name: Description
label.description: A free-text note about the physical nature, subject matter, historical context, biographical context, or interpretation, as is relevant to whatever you are describing, whether it is an object in the collection, or a person. For items with inscriptions, stamps, signatures, or any other marking, record this information here. If any text is a quotation, please cite the source of information. Cite any other sources including books, websites or interviews which provided information.

label.name: Inscription
label.description: All marks or written words added to the object at the time of production or in its subsequent history, including signatures, dates, dedications, texts, and colophons, as well as marks, such as the stamps of silversmiths, publishers, or printers. The position/location of this text or symbol should be specified. If a translation of the text into the language of the catalog record is also provided, include in a repeated element with the text type of translation.

label.name: Location
label.description: The geographic location and/or name of the repository, building, site, or other entity whose boundaries include the Work or Image.

label.name: Material
label.description: The medium or substance of which a work or an image is composed and the production or manufacturing processes, techniques, and methods incorporated in the fabrication or alteration of the work or image.

label.name: Measurements
label.description: The physical size, shape, scale, dimensions, extent, or technical format of an item, collection, or accession.

label.name: Permissions & Rights
label.description: Information about the copyright status and the rights holder for a work, collection, or image. The optional notes sub-element may include any justifications, conditions, or restraints on use, contact or licensing information, or other intellectual property statements as may be desired.

label.name: Source Set
label.description: A reference to the source of the information recorded about the work or the image. For a work record, this may be a citation to the sole source of the information recorded in a catalog record. For an image, it may be used to provide information about the supplying agency, vendor or individual.

label.name: Edition
label.description: This can be used to describe the issuance of a work in relation to previous or subsequent editions. Example: 2nd edition. It can be used for works issued in multiples, with the number assigned to a particular item within a specific edition or production run. Example: 5/50. It can also be used for information about the edition. Example: Special edition

label.name: Style or Period Set
label.description: A defined style

label.name: Technique
label.description: The production or manufacturing processes, techniques, and methods incorporated in the fabrication or alteration of the work or image.

label.name: TextRef Set
label.description: Contains the name of a related textual reference and any type of unique identifier that text assigns to a Work or Collection that is independent of any repository.

label.name: Title type
label.description: this can be used to express whether the title was derived from the object itself or the creator of the object, (as in the case for many publications or works of art), or if the title was constructed by the cataloger- the title would be descriptive, transcribed, etc.

label.name: Work type
label.description: Identifies the specific type of WORK, COLLECTION, or IMAGE being described in the record.

label.name: Language
label.description: list what language(s) is/are on this object. In the case of subtitles, additionally list the language of subtitles. It is possible to add multiple languages by clicking the “Add language” button.

label.name: Measurements and Extent
label.description: The physical size, shape, scale, dimensions, extent, or technical format of an item, collection, or accession. Use measurements that are appropriate for the format of the item you are cataloging. Specify the page count for books, objects in a set (like # of prints in a portfolio), running time and technical format for audiovisual media, length x width x height dimensions of 2D and 3D objects, diameter of round objects, size for clothing, and appropriate info for digital works such as format or resolution. The units of measurement should be specified- inches, centimeters, pages, timecode, etc.

label.name: Inscriptions and Marks
label.description: All marks or written words added to the object at the time of production or in its subsequent history, including signatures, dates, dedications, texts, and colophons, as well as marks, such as the stamps of silversmiths, publishers, or printers. The position/location of this text or symbol should be specified. If a translation of the text into the language of the catalog record is also provided, include in a repeated element with the text type of translation.

label.name: Materials and Techniques
label.description: if you can, identify the materials used in the creation of a work. Also indicate any known production or manufacturing techniques, processes, or methods used for creation. Example: 2 color screenprint on blue, acid free, matte paper.

label.name: Format
label.description: Types of textual, graphic, electronic, or physical items.

label.name: Holdings
label.description: The number of copies of an item in Interference Archive's collection or in cases of periodicals, a description of the number of specific issues in the collection. Example of holdings for several copies of the same print: 3 copies Example of holdings for a periodical in a series record: 2 copies of vol.14 no. 2(Summer, 1994)

label.name: Enumeration and Chronology
label.description:
A number for an individual item in a set or series (like one volume in a set of books), or for periodicals and serials it can refer to volumes and/or issue numbers, (which is called enumeration), and the year(s) and/or any seasonal information (which is called chronology).
Example for book in a set: vol. 1 Example for magazine: vol. 1, no. 4 (Summer 1987)

label.name: Accession Date
label.description: Date materials were added to or removed from the collection.

label.name: Accession Date type
label.description: Type of date

label.name: Description
label.description: A free-text note about the physical nature, subject matter, historical context, biographical context, or interpretation, as is relevant to whatever you are describing, whether it is an object in the collection, or a person. For items with inscriptions, stamps, signatures, or any other marking, record this information here. If any text is a quotation, please cite the source of information. Cite any other sources including books, websites or interviews which provided information.

label.name: Representation view type (i.e. What am I seeing?)
label.description: This element describes the nature of the digital media representation that appears in the catalog.

label.name: Editeur de configuration de types de relation
Editeur de configuration de formulaires de recherche

settings.setting:
This is the field for the people, families, or organizations that are responsible for the creation of an object. Entities have different "roles" they play in the creation of a work (Ex: author, artist, printer, etc.), or may have contributed to an object in some way even if they are not the person primarily responsible for it's creation (Ex: distributor, producer, or publisher)
If a person is the subject of the work, do not list them here. List them as a subject term.
Place of Creation, Publication, or Distribution
A place to record comments or questions pertaining to the object or record

role.name: Administrators
role.description: Confers actions needed by those administering the system

role.name: Cataloguers
role.description: Confers actions needed by those editing catalogue entries

role.name: Researcher
role.description: Allows users to only search and view - but not edit - catalogue entries

role.name: User content moderator
role.description: Allows users to moderate user generated tags and comments

role.name: Accessioner
role.description: Provides access to actions and metadata fields needed for accessioning donations

role.name: Donor Information Manager
role.description: Provides access to donor contact information

group.name: Administrators
group.description: System administrators. By default, administrators can perform all the actions of the other user groups.

group.name: Cataloguers
group.description: Users who can add and edit catalogue entries in addition to actions available to accessioners.

group.name: Accessioner
group.description: Provides the ability to enter information for accessioning a donation by assigning it a lot number. This is the most basic user group.

group.name: Donor Information Manager
group.description: This group manages donor contact information and can perform all the actions of the cataloguer.

label.name: Test form for entities linked to lots
